title: Thibaut Courtois fires warning to Chelsea's title rivals after Blues tighten their grip at the top
text:
Thibaut Courtois fires warning to Chelsea's title rivals after Blues tighten their grip at the top The keeper claims the Blues are sitting pretty at the top after re-establishing their seven-point lead Share Thibaut Courtois celebrates in front of Chelsea's fans (Photo: Plumb Images) Share Get Chelsea FC     
Thibaut Courtois has warned Chelsea ’s title rivals all of the pressure is on them. 
Courtois claims the Blues are sitting pretty at the top after re-establishing their seven-point lead, and it is the chasing pack who should be afraid. 
The Chelsea keeper admits that the likes of Liverpool, Arsenal and Manchester City were waiting for them to slip up after their defeat at Tottenham and the Diego Costa row. 
But Courtois says the emphatic 3-0 victory at the home of champions Leicester proved they can cope without Costa, and they’re determined to remain top for the rest of the season. View gallery 
“We are seven points clear and the pressure is more on the other teams than on us,” said Belgium star Courtois. 
“This was a fixutre where, if I’m sitting at home and an opponent plays away at Leicester, I think they can drop points. 
“So it was very good of us not to do that and to win well. We have to get three points at home to Hull next and then we go to Anfield in a couple of weeks with the gap we have now. Read More
